meanings.definition: The office or position of a priest.
meanings.sent1: In our church, the priesthood is responsible for leading the congregation in prayer.
meanings.sent2: The priesthood plays a vital role in performing religious ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The priesthood decided to have a potluck instead of a traditional service, causing quite a stir.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her role in the priesthood shines like a beacon of faith.
meanings.sent5: The solemnity of the priesthood ceremony left a lasting impression on the attendees.

meanings.definition: The body of priests in a particular religion.
meanings.sent1: The priesthood gathered to discuss the upcoming festival.
meanings.sent2: Members of the priesthood often provide guidance and support to the community.
meanings.sent3: During the annual retreat, the priesthood challenged each other to a friendly game of volleyball.
meanings.sent4: The unity within the priesthood is as strong as the foundation of the church itself.
meanings.sent5: The traditions of the priesthood have been passed down for generations, preserving our beliefs.

meanings.definition: The order or class of priests in a religion.
meanings.sent1: The priesthood follows a strict code of conduct to uphold their values.
meanings.sent2: Within the priesthood, there are different ranks based on experience and knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The annual priesthood bake-off competition always brings out the competitive spirit.
meanings.sent4: The bond between members of the priesthood transcends mere friendship.
meanings.sent5: The history of the priesthood dates back centuries, shaping the faith of many generations.
